title: Help message when subtracting two types that can't be subtracted is incorrect

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
fn f<Amount, TotalAmount>(amount: Amount, total_amount: TotalAmount) {
    let total_amount = amount - total_amount;
}
```

I expected to see this happen: Error with help: 
```
error[E0369]: cannot subtract `TotalAmount` from `Amount`
 --> src\main.rs:5:31
  |
5 |     let total_amount = amount - total_amount;
  |                        ------ ^ ------------ TotalAmount
  |                        |
  |                        Amount
  |
help: consider restricting type parameter `Amount`
  |
4 | fn f<Amount: std::ops::Sub<TotalAmount, Output = TotalAmount>, TotalAmount>(amount: Amount, total_amount: TotalAmount) {
```

Instead, this happened: 
```
error[E0369]: cannot subtract `TotalAmount` from `Amount`
 --> src\main.rs:5:31
  |
5 |     let total_amount = amount - total_amount;
  |                        ------ ^ ------------ TotalAmount
  |                        |
  |                        Amount
  |
help: consider restricting type parameter `Amount`
  |
4 | fn f<Amount: std::ops::Sub<Output = TotalAmount>, TotalAmount>(amount: Amount, total_amount: TotalAmount) {
```

Need to add TotalAmount to help.
